articles.title: India’s Dog Bite Crisis: Around 22 Lakh Cases Reported in 2024
articles.description: Government data shows nearly 22 lakh dog bite cases in India in 2024, with over 5 lakh victims under 15 years of age.
articles.content: About 21,95,122 dog bite cases were reported in India during 2024 — of these, 519,704 involved children under 15 years of age, according to government data presented in Parliament. Stray dogs and related bite incidents continue to pose a major public health challenge. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}
articles.author: Harikishan Sharma

articles.title: Around 14 People, Including 8-Year-Old, Injured in Dog Attack in Tamil Nadu
articles.description: Residents of Kattaiyapuram reported multiple people, including a child, were bitten by an aggressive dog.
articles.content: According to local posts, around 14 people — including an eight-year-old child — sustained level-3 dog bite injuries after a dog attacked residents of Kattaiyapuram village. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

articles.title: Dog Bites Rise in Tambaram; Residents Cite Poor Enforcement
articles.description: Dog bite cases are rising sharply in Tambaram with dozens reported weekly.
articles.content: In Tambaram, Chennai, residents are alarmed by a surge in dog bite incidents, saying enforcement of safety orders is weak. Over 450 cases were reported in recent weeks. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

articles.title: Punjab Govt Extends Anti-Rabies Vaccination After High Dog Bite Cases
articles.description: Punjab expands free anti-rabies vaccination to more clinics to protect children and adults.
articles.content: To address the significant number of dog bite cases — including those among children — Punjab extended anti-rabies vaccine access to 881 clinics across the state. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

articles.title: Supreme Court Orders Relocation of Stray Dogs to Shelters
articles.description: India’s Supreme Court directs authorities to relocate stray dogs from public places to shelters.
articles.content: The Supreme Court ordered authorities in Delhi and surrounding areas to remove stray dogs from public spaces and relocate them to shelters within set deadlines, citing rising dog-bite concerns. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

articles.title: For Every Dog Bite, Heavy Compensation Likely On States: SC
articles.description: Supreme Court warns states may be asked to pay compensation for each child or elderly victim of dog bites.
articles.content: The Supreme Court cautioned that state governments could face compensation liabilities for deaths or injuries from dog bites if they fail to implement stray dog control rules effectively. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}

articles.title: When Law Bites Back: India’s Unresolved Stray Dog Debate
articles.description: Supreme Court emphasizes public safety in stray dog hearing, balancing rights of humans and animals.
articles.content: In recent hearings, the Supreme Court stressed that public safety — especially of children and the elderly — cannot be overlooked while managing stray dog populations, and highlighted the need for accountability in enforcement. :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}

articles.title: Celebrities Criticise SC’s Stray Dog Removal Directive
articles.description: Celebrities like Janhvi Kapoor and Varun Dhawan speak out against the Supreme Court order to remove stray dogs. :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}

articles.title: Stray Dogs Attack Children in Nagpur, Spark Panic
articles.description: Several children mauled by stray dogs in Nagpur’s Salfiyabad Colony, residents demand action.
articles.content: Three children aged eight and nine were injured by packs of stray dogs while playing outside their homes, triggering outrage over civic inaction. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}

articles.title: Supreme Court Warns Heavy Compensation in Dog Bite Cases
articles.description: SC slams stray dog bite incidents and warns of compensation for states and feeders.
articles.content: In its January 2026 hearing, the Supreme Court cautioned that states and people feeding strays may be held liable and must ensure safety amid rising dog bite incidents. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

articles.title: Four Children Mauled, Including 3-Year-Old, in Taloja Stray Dog Attack
articles.description: Outrage as stray dogs maul four children in Navi Mumbai’s Taloja, residents protest.
articles.content: A pack of stray dogs attacked five people, including four children, prompting protests demanding decisive municipal action. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

articles.title: Delhi University Considers Fencing Campus to Ward Off Stray Dogs
articles.description: DU explores fencing measures to prevent stray dog intrusions and reduce bite risks on campus.
articles.content: Following Supreme Court directives to curb stray dog bite incidents, Delhi University is considering fencing its North Campus and issuing SOPs for safer campuses. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

articles.title: Punjab Municipal Corporation Sterilises Over 3,000 Stray Dogs
articles.description: Patna’s civic body sterilises thousands of strays to manage population and reduce bites.
articles.content: The Patna Municipal Corporation sterilised more than 3,000 stray dogs as part of ABC initiatives to reduce aggressive behaviour and disease transmission. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

articles.title: Ludhiana Sees Multiple Stray Dog Attacks on Children in 2025
articles.description: Several children were attacked by stray dogs in Ludhiana, highlighting a growing canine menace.
articles.content: Recent reports from Ludhiana state that stray dogs attacked multiple children in separate incidents, with some injuries requiring medical treatment. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}

articles.title: Celebrities Slam Supreme Court's Stray Dog Removal Ruling
articles.description: Bollywood stars oppose the SC directive to relocate stray dogs to shelters, calling it cruel.
articles.content: Celebrities like Janhvi Kapoor, Varun Dhawan, Tiger Shroff, Sophie Choudry, and Raveena Tandon criticized the Supreme Court’s decision, calling it inhumane and urging more humane solutions. :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}

articles.title: Shriya Pilgaonkar, Mohit Chauhan Oppose SC Verdict on Stray Dogs
articles.description: Celebs advocate a balanced, humane approach instead of harsh relocation for stray dogs.
articles.content: Actors Shriya Pilgaonkar and Mohit Chauhan reacted against the Supreme Court’s order, arguing for balanced sterilisation, vaccination, and humane care over relocation. :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}

articles.title: Actress Rasha Thadani Condemns SC Stray Dog Order
articles.description: Rasha Thadani labels the Supreme Court’s stray dog relocation order as 'beyond disheartening'.
articles.content: Actress Rasha Thadani spoke out against the Supreme Court’s stray dog relocation ruling, calling for compassion and humane treatment instead of forced removal. :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}

articles.title: Mazel Vyas Highlights Shelter Overcrowding After SC Ruling
articles.description: TV actress Mazel Vyas criticises the Supreme Court’s stray dog relocation directive, pointing out overcrowded shelters.
articles.content: Mazel Vyas said most shelters lack adequate capacity and funds, making the court’s relocation order impractical and risking canine welfare. :contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}

articles.title: India’s Dog Bite Crisis: Around 22 Lakh Cases Reported in 2024
articles.description: Government data shows nearly 22 lakh dog bite cases in India in 2024, with over 5 lakh victims under 15 years of age.
articles.content: About 21,95,122 dog bite cases were reported in India during 2024 — of these, 519,704 involved children under 15 years of age, according to government data presented in Parliament. Stray dogs and related bite incidents continue to pose a major public health challenge. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}
articles.author: Harikishan Sharma

articles.title: Toddler Survives Attack by Pack of Stray Dogs in Belagavi
articles.description: A two-year-old was severely bitten by a pack of stray dogs while playing near his home in Belagavi.
articles.content: A toddler was grievously injured after seven to eight stray dogs suddenly attacked and bit him multiple times. Local residents rescued the child, who was admitted for treatment, prompting fear and anger in the neighbourhood. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

articles.title: 6-Year-Old Girl Dies of Rabies Despite Treatment in Thane
articles.description: A six-year-old girl bitten by a community dog died of rabies despite completing treatment.
articles.content: The child from Diva, bitten on shoulder and cheeks by a community dog, completed a month of post-bite treatment, but later developed rabies symptoms and died, raising questions about stray dog control measures. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

articles.title: When Law Bites Back: India’s Unresolved Stray Dog Debate
articles.description: In 2024 India logged over 3.7 million dog bite cases, with 54 suspected rabies deaths, prompting legal debate on stray dogs. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}
articles.content: World Atlas and NCDC data show India ranks seventh globally for dog population. The spike in bites and rabies deaths has triggered legal scrutiny and debate over stray dog management strategies. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

articles.title: 100 Dog Bites a Day, Chandigarh Faces Stray Dog Crisis
articles.description: Chandigarh logs an average of over 100 dog bite cases daily and plans a dedicated shelter. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}
articles.content: The city recorded 36,515 bite incidents in 11 months, prompting efforts to build a two-storey dog shelter aligned with welfare and SC directives to ease the strain on residents. :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}

articles.title: Supreme Court Orders Removal of Stray Dogs From Delhi NCR
articles.description: India’s Supreme Court orders authorities to relocate stray dogs from public areas in NCR amid rising bites. :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}
articles.content: In a landmark hearing, SC pulled up local authorities for stray dog menace and directed relocation of strays to shelters, citing public safety concerns. :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}

articles.title: Supreme Court Stray Dogs Case Transferred to New Bench Ahead of Hearing
articles.description: CJI assigns stray dog case to a fresh 3-judge bench for further hearings. :contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}
articles.content: The Supreme Court has shifted the suo motu stray dogs case to a new bench headed by Justices Vikram Nath and others, to hear public safety and welfare aspects. :contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}

articles.title: Supreme Court Sees Surge in Pleas in Stray Dogs Case
articles.description: SC observes unusually high number of applications filed in stray dog case hearings. :contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}
articles.content: Justice Nath and Justice Mehta noted an unprecedented volume of interlocutory applications in the stray dogs case, a level not often seen even in human rights cases. :contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}

articles.title: Public Opinion Divided Over Supreme Court’s Stray Dog Order
articles.description: Public, politicians, and celebrities are divided on the SC order to relocate stray dogs. :contentReference[oaicite:13]{index=13}
articles.content: Business Standard reports that while some support SC’s safety concerns, others criticise the directive as inhumane and impractical, calling for humane sterilisation and vaccination. :contentReference[oaicite:14]{index=14}

articles.title: Celebrities React to SC’s Stray Dog Removal Order
articles.description: Bollywood stars including John Abraham, Janhvi Kapoor and Vir Das criticise the SC directive on stray dogs. :contentReference[oaicite:15]{index=15}
articles.content: Following the SC order on Aug 11 to remove stray dogs from Delhi-NCR, actors and entertainers called for a review, urging humane solutions such as sterilisation and shelter reform. :contentReference[oaicite:16]{index=16}

articles.title: Ram Gopal Varma Criticises Dog Lovers After SC Order
articles.description: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma slams critics of the Supreme Court’s stray dog relocation policy. :contentReference[oaicite:17]{index=17}
articles.content: Varma questioned the practicality of shelters and vaccination drives, suggesting more aggressive action to protect public safety, citing ongoing bite and rabies concerns. :contentReference[oaicite:18]{index=18}

articles.title: Vahbbiz Dorabjee Reacts to Supreme Court Stray Dog Ruling
articles.description: TV actress Vahbbiz Dorabjee calls the SC dog shelter directive 'absolute shock' and ineffective. :contentReference[oaicite:19]{index=19}
articles.content: In an exclusive interview, Vahbbiz Dorabjee criticised the Supreme Court’s order to move stray dogs to shelters, saying humane alternatives are needed. :contentReference[oaicite:20]{index=20}

articles.title: MCD Proposes Microchipping and Vaccination Drive for Stray Dogs in Delhi
articles.description: MCD plans digital tracking and microchipping of stray dogs to better monitor bites and vaccination. :contentReference[oaicite:21]{index=21}
articles.content: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi proposed microchipping stray dogs with digital IDs, improving tracking, vaccination, and bite complaint controls across the city. :contentReference[oaicite:22]{index=22}

articles.title: Belagavi Steps Up Stray Dog Control After Toddler Attack
articles.description: Belagavi authorities accelerate stray dog control following a toddler attack. :contentReference[oaicite:23]{index=23}
articles.content: After a toddler was critically injured in a stray dog attack, Belagavi city corporation finished a shelter and care centre, started sterilisation surgeries, and designated feeding zones. :contentReference[oaicite:24]{index=24}
